content.raw: Publishers allow client and servers to initiate communication, using typed messages. The messages are defined in G**a**zebo using Protobuf, and **they** are accessed in javascript via a JSON representation.
content.html: Publishers allow client and servers to initiate communication, using typed messages. The messages are defined in Gazebo using Protobuf, and they are accessed in javascript via a JSON representation.

content.raw: Important question... I tried to answer it in the tutorial
content.html: Important question... I tried to answer it in the tutorial

For me this only works sometimes. I found out if I add a little delay it always works though:

setTimeout(function (){
  gazebo.publish(type, topic , msg);
  console.log('\npublished!');
},10);

content.raw:
I made and issue out of it, because we should not require users to add delays for their code to work.
https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebojs/issue/2

content.raw: We're trying to version all example programs. Create a directory called `files` in your tutorial and put `model.js` in it. Then, you can use the `<include src='...' />` tag to render the content of the file in the tutorial. Look for `include src` in the tutorials to find examples. Then, you can offer a link for downloading the file instead of pasting the content.
content.html: We're trying to version all example programs. Create a directory called files in your tutorial and put model.js in it. Then, you can use the <include src='...' /> tag to render the content of the file in the tutorial. Look for include src in the tutorials to find examples. Then, you can offer a link for downloading the file instead of pasting the content.
